questionTitle: Which of the following is a specific top-level domain created for the producers and consumers of mobile services?
questionExplanation: .MOBI is maintained as a registry called the Mobile Top Level Domain (mTLD).

questionOption1: Mobile phones are differentiated into feature phones and smartphones
questionOption2: Cloud computing offers the capability to run cell phone applications and Web services and to store data remotely
questionOption3: The eventual impact of the cloud on mobile devices will be to make them thicker(as client)
questionExplanation: Many applications that run on smartphones, and in many cases features found in feature phones, are dependent upon the Web services found in the cloud.

questionTitle: Which of the following domain is used to create sites that render correctly on mobile devices?
questionExplanation: This domain is a sponsored domain and was created by a group of companies in the mobile space.

questionTitle: Which of the following tool analyzes Websites and scores them by dotMobi?
questionExplanation: However, dotMobi doesnâ€™t mandate that a Website use any specific technologies, only that it be mobile-device-friendly.

questionOption1: Mobile Web services are those in which information is transferred between applications and services over an Internet connection
questionOption2: The mobile Web is fractured into many different competing operating systems and proprietary hardware
questionOption3: The lack of expandable storage on mobile devices is a classic example of vendor lock-in
questionExplanation: W3C Mobile Web Initiative sought to make browsing the Web with mobile devices more reliable by setting standards that Website designers can use to make their sites mobile-friendly.

questionTitle: Which of the following mechanism is suited for content compatibility on the mobile Web?
questionExplanation: In HTTP, content negotiation is a mechanism by which user agents can be served a different document or file format based on going to the same URI.

questionTitle: Which of the following group aimed at promoting standards on mobile networks?
questionExplanation: OMTP stands for Open Terminal Platform.

questionTitle: Which of the following vendors were part of WAC promote the market for mobile applications?
questionExplanation: WAC stands for the Wholesale Applications Community.

questionTitle: Which of the following framework is used for creating mobile interfaces and subsystems by OMTP?
questionExplanation: XACML is an OASIS standard that describes both a policy language and an access control decision request/response language (both written in XML).

questionTitle: Which of the following standard mobile API is based on a set of JavaScript APIs?
questionExplanation: The Wholesale Applications Community is an industry group aimed at standardizing and promoting mobile applications.
